isis.stitle: TSI 04-03-03 - Air Suspension Dump Operation With Dual Solenoid Control Valves

subjectgroup.subject: Air Suspension Dump Operation With Dual Solenoid Control Valves

geninfo.para: The effective dates for the models listed above are:

After the above referenced dates the HPV Air Suspension Control System was revised to be controlled by the ESC using two air solenoids and a shuttle valve. The revision was accompanied by the changing of the 0595042 code to 0595273. The suspension input is provided by a two position, bi-stable switch that has an indicator light in the upper (Dump) position. When the Air Suspension Dump (ASD) switch is in the "DUMP" position, the operator is requesting the ESC to release air from the air suspension. When the ASD is in the "SUSP" position, the operator is requesting the air suspension to be, or remain, supplied with air pressure. When requesting suspension dump, the system is applying air pressure to the Dump Control Line port of the Hadley Height Control Valve mounted above the rear axle. The following will provide additional information to help the technician better understand the system function to aid in the troubleshooting process.

svcproc.title: Procedure
svcproc.para: The two air solenoids mentioned above in the system description control a two position shuttle valve that either feeds air pressure (dump) or vents (suspension active) the control line that is connected to the dump port of the Hadley Control Valve. The two normally open (when no power is applied) air solenoids will be set to opposite states under normal key on conditions. The suspension dump operation will only change state when the key switch is in the run, crank, or acc position. When the key is off, or there is an error, both air solenoids will be de-energized. See Figure 1 for system layout and function.
When the ESC commands the "DUMP" operation:

item.para: The ASD solenoid A will be de-energized (open)
And the ASD solenoid B will be energized (closed)
Shuttle valve passes air pressure from solenoid A to Dump Control Line

svcproc.para: When the ESC commands the "SUSP" operation:

item.para: The ASD solenoid A will be energized (closed)
And the ASD solenoid B will be de-energized (open)
Shuttle closes air pressure feed to Dump Control Line and vents it

svcproc.para: When switching from "SUSP" to "DUMP" the suspension will dump if:

item.para: The vehicle is moving less than the maximum allowable dump speed
And the ASD switch is in the "DUMP" position
And the key is in the RUN or ACC position
And the key state signal must report a good status
And the Wheel Based Vehicle Speed signal must report a good status
And there is not a Traction Control or ABS event.
